title: Making sense of NBA trade deadline week: We picked the real winners and losers
content: After a wild week of superstar movement, Zach Kram unveils his winners and losers of the NBA trade deadline.

title: Sources: Skubal wins arbitration, to make $32M
content: Two-time reigning AL Cy Young winner Tarik Skubal won his arbitration case over the Tigers and will make $32 million this year, sources told ESPN, giving the ace $13 million more than Detroit offered.

title: Sources: Clippers trading center Zubac to Pacers
content: The Clippers are trading center Ivica Zubac to the Pacers in exchange for Bennedict Mathurin, Isaiah Jackson, Indiana's protected 2026 first-round pick and unprotected 2029 first-round pick

title: Sources: Thomas free agent after Nets cut him
content: The Nets released guard Cam Thomas, allowing him to enter free agency and sign with any other team, sources told ESPN.

title: Bulls aim to exit NBA's 'middle' with busy deadline
content: After an uncommonly active trade deadline, Bulls VP Arturas Karnisovas said the franchise is "not satisfied" with being mediocre in a shift in tone from previous years.

title: Draymond remains with Warriors past deadline
content: Draymond Green will remain with Golden State past Thursday's trade deadline as the Warriors believe he fits well with the newly acquired Kristaps Porzingis.

title: Seahawks 'fully expect' Emmanwori to play in SB
content: The Seahawks "fully expect" Nick Emmanwori to play in Super Bowl LX after he left practice yesterday with an ankle injury, coach Mike Macdonald said Thursday.

title: Ex-Patriots call 'bullcrap' on Brady's SB stance
content: Tom Brady said he doesn't have a "dog in the fight" in this year's Super Bowl, and his former New England Patriots teammates are calling "bullcrap."

title: Sources: Knicks acquiring PG Alvarado from Pels
content: The Knicks are acquiring guard Jose Alvarado from the Pelicans in exchange for Dalen Terry, two second-round picks and cash, sources told ESPN.

title: ⚾ Olney and Passan's MLB offseason lessons
content: From more outrage over MLB's top spenders to what to make of deals that never happened, here's what we learned this winter.

title: Barnwell’s annual Super Bowl opus: We size up every facet of Seahawks-Patriots and pick the winner
content: Can Drake Maye hit enough big plays? Which Sam Darnold will show up? And will defense define this Super Bowl matchup? Let's go deep on Seahawks-Patriots.

title: The Faces of the Games: 32 U.S. Olympians to watch
content: On Friday, the 2026 Milan Cortina Olympics will kick off. From Lindsey Vonn to Amber Glenn, here are the athletes you'll want to know.

title: Women's Power Rankings: Can Texas exact revenge and snap LSU's win streak?
content: The Tigers seek to sweep a key series in the SEC, but the Longhorns look to avenge their loss in Baton Rouge from last month.

title: Wetzel: Standing on the brink of anything-goes NCAA eligibility
content: By not controlling who is eligible, the NCAA is losing the ability to function as an organizing athletic body.

title: How Laila Edwards carved her own path as USA Hockey's first Black player
content: Laila Edwards, a standout at Wisconsin, is ready for her Olympic debut as USA Hockey's first Black player.

title: Who you calling old? At the 2026 Olympics, age is just a number
content: Lindsey Vonn, Nick Goepper, Gus Kenworthy and Maddy Schaffrick are in their golden years at the 2026 Olympics. Just don't call them old.

title: NHL Awards Watch: Kucherov gaining on MacKinnon for MVP?
content: We polled PHWA voters to find out who's ahead in the major races as some new names have entered the conversation for the Hart and Vezina.

title: Super Bowl LX: Seahawks-Patriots marks latest rematch in big game
content: This year marks the 10th different repeat Super Bowl matchup and the fourth the New England Patriots are involved in themselves.

title: Go big or go home: Super Bowl LX's most outrageous menu items
content: From a bone-in "Hammer" burger to a frozen Irish coffee float, this year's game-day eats are as grand as the stage itself.

title: Sixty bets for Super Bowl LX
content: We navigated the thousands of bets being offered for Super Bowl LX and narrowed it down to our 60 favorite from 10 different categories.

title: Super Bowl LX betting buzz: Bettor places $1,000 MVP wagers on Super Bowl kickers
content: Multiple sportsbooks have reported taking MVP wagers on longshots, including a variety of Seahawks defenders.

title: High school stories of 11 Super Bowl stars -- and two coaches
content: Find out what Sam Darnold, Drake Maye, Cooper Kupp, TreVeyon Henderson and others were like before the NFL.

title: Wrexham have Premier League in sight, just five years after Reynolds and Mac takeover
content: Feb. 9 marks five years since Ryan Reynolds and Rob Mac completed their Wrexham takeover and already, they're on track for promotion to the Premier League.

title: Road to $1M paydays: How WNBA salaries evolved with each CBA
content: For the first time, a $1 million base salary is expected in the new WNBA CBA, and the cap could see a 230% increase.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams stack up ahead of trade deadline
content: Which players are under the most pressure and where all 30 teams rank a day before the Thursday trade deadline.

title: 12 teams that improved their 2026 CFP chances with their roster moves
content: With signing day closing many team's personnel moves, we look at the teams ready to make long postseason runs.

title: From AD and Harden to Zubac and Vucevic: Fantasy reaction to the latest NBA trades
content: Andre Snellings and Eric Moody provide fantasy reactions as trades go down leading up to Thursday's NBA trade deadline.

title: Men's boxing pound-for-pound rankings: Stevenson moves up, shakes up the top 10
content: Shakur Stevenson's victory over Teofimo Lopez Jr. vaulted him up the list, but just how high did he climb? Here are the latest ESPN pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Iran's Supreme Leader "Should Be Very Worried": Trump Ahead Of Oman Talks
content: US President Donald Trump delivered a forceful warning to Iran's top leadership this week, saying Iran's supreme leader "should be very worried" as the two countries prepare for resumed nuclear negotiations.

title: Rajasthan Thieves Lift Woman, 90, Along With Cot To Loot Silver Jewellery
content: Amid a sharp rise in silver prices, a shocking incident has been reported from Kothia village in the Arwad area of Bhilwara district, where thieves abducted a 90-year-old woman along with her cot in an attempt to rob her of 1.5 kg of silver jewellery

title: Trump Has No "Formal Plans" To Deploy ICE At Polling Sites: White House
content: President Donald Trump has not discussed "formal plans" to deploy US Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents to polling sites at November's midterm elections, the White House said on Thursday.

title: Iranian Foreign Minister Arrives In Oman For Nuclear Talks With US
content: Iran's foreign minister arrived in Oman late Thursday for nuclear talks with the United States, Iranian state news agency IRNA reported.

title: Trump Urges New Nuclear Treaty After Russia Agreement Ends
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday called for a brand new nuclear treaty after the last agreement with Russia expired, prompting fears of a new global arms race.

title: Pariksha Pe Charcha 2026: PM Modi To Address Students At 10 AM Today
content: PM Modi will engage with students across India in the annual 'Pariksha Pe Charcha' (PPC) event on Friday at 10 AM. The 2026 edition will focus on helping students remain stress-free during examinations and encouraging a stronger emphasis on learning.

title: 'No Such Meeting Took Place': India On Reports Of Doval, Rubio Meeting
content: The Ministry of External Affairs on Thursday slammed the media report, alluding a meeting between National Security Advisor Ajit Doval and US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, calling it baseless.

title: Court Order On Tax Case Today: How It May Impact Vijay's Political Career
content: The Madras High Court is set to pass orders on Friday on a crucial income tax dispute involving Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) chief and actor Vijay, a case that has assumed political significance as he prepares for his electoral debut.

title: Epstein Wanted Enhancement Pills, Had Low Testosterone: Medical Records
content: Recently disclosed files from the US Department of Justice shed new light on Jeffrey Epstein's health history, revealing persistent hormonal deficiencies and past sexually transmitted infections, according to medical records.

title: Retired IIT Medical Officer Loses Rs 4.62 Crore To 'Digital Arrest Scam'
content: Two persons were arrested after a 74-year-old woman, who retired as medical officer of Indian Institute of Technology Bombay, was cheated of Rs 4.62 crore through threats of CBI action in a non-existent money laundering case.

title: Social Media Influencer Arrested In Kolkata For Allegedly Assaulting Girlfriend
content: A popular social media influencer from Kolkata was arrested on Thursday evening on charges of forcibly detaining and molesting his girlfriend.

title: Congress Holds Protest March In Chennai Over Replacing MGNREGA
content: The Tamil Nadu Congress on Thursday took out a high-decibel protest march in Chennai's Tambaram, launching a sharp attack on the Centre over replacing the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme (MGNREGA) with the VB-G Ram G scheme.

title: World Economic Forum Investigates Its CEO Over Links With Epstein
content: The World Economic Forum has launched an independent investigation into its CEO Borge Brende to clarify his relationship with sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, the organisation said on Thursday.

title: Anthropic Unveils Latest AI Model As OpenAI Rivalry Intensifies
content: Anthropic on Thursday released its latest high-performing artificial intelligence model, escalating its challenge to OpenAI and Google in the intensifying AI race.

title: Kuki-Zo Body Declares Social Boycott Of MLAs Who Joined Manipur Government
content: A day after the Yumnam Khemchand Singh-led BJP government assumed office following the withdrawal of President's Rule in Manipur, the Kuki-Zo Council (KZC), on Thursday declared a social boycott of all Kuki-Zo MLAs who participated in its formation.

title: Bangladesh Rushes For 'Secret' US Trade Deal After India's Tariff Gains
content: The United States and Bangladesh are set to sign a trade agreement on February 9, just 72 hours before the national election on February 12. The deal has faced significant criticism because of secrecy surrounding its terms.

title: 70% Of Air India Planes Have Recurring Technical Issues: Centre
content: More than seven out of every ten aircraft reviewed in the Air India Group fleet have shown recurring technical defects, according to official data tabled in Parliament on Thursday.

title: "What Do We Do With Shaadi.com?" Irked Top Court In Matrimonial Dispute Case
content: The Supreme Court while hearing a case involving matrimonial discord today, expressed concern about the online platform Shaadi.com.

title: 'Will Teach You MNS Style': Leader's Threat To Bank Official Over Marathi
content: The language issue reared its head again on Thursday after a Maharashtra Navnirman Sena leader confronted a bank official in Mumbai for refusing to speak in Marathi and threatened to teach him a lesson in "MNS style"

title: Poll Panel Tells Top Court Bengal Government 'Wilfully Neglected' Directions
content: The Election Commission has told the Supreme Court that the enumeration phase of the special intensive revision of electoral rolls in West Bengal saw several incidents of violence, intimidation and obstruction against election officials.

title: Married woman can’t claim rape on false marriage promise: Supreme Court
content: A bench of Justices B V Nagarathna and Ujjal Bhuyan said in such cases, a woman was not eligible to get married due to the subsistence of her marriage and she could not invoke the ground of false promise of marriage. It passed the order while quashing criminal proceedings against a lawyer on a complaint filed by a woman advocate alleging that he had raped her on the false promise of marriage.

title: India import of Russian crude in December lowest since February 2025
content: The US had announced sanctions on the two companies on Oct 22 and set Nov 21 as the deadline for all dealings with them to be wound down. As per data shared by the ministry of commerce and industry, Dec supplies of Russian oil were nearly 27% lower compared with imports worth $3.7 billion a month earlier in Nov 2025, and over 15% lower than the $3.2 billion imported during the corresponding month in 2024.

title: IndiGo’s December disruption stranded 16.2 lakh domestic flyers: DGCA
content: The directorate’s monthly traffic data for Dec 2025 says 16.2 lakh domestic flyers were stranded at airports across the country due to the non-availability of either IndiGo aircraft or their crew members. The number of people affected due to total cancellation of flights was 9.8 lakh, while those stranded at the airports due to delays beyond two hours were 6.4 lakh.

title: 'Every day can't be tukka': Rishabh Pant's explosive verdict on Abhishek Sharma
content: Rishabh Pant has identified Abhishek Sharma as cricket's most dangerous batter currently, praising his consistent, fearless approach and belief. Pant also shared insights from Rahul Dravid's advice on maintaining emotional balance, emphasizing the importance of remaining grounded whether scoring runs or failing. This perspective highlights the mental fortitude required for elite athletes.

title: 5 LCA Mk1A fighter jets fully ready for delivery to IAF: HAL
content: HAL said that “an additional nine aircraft have already been built and flown. Upon receipt of engines from General Electric (US company), these aircraft will be made ready for delivery”. “All design and development issues identified are being addressed in an expedited manner. HAL is in active discussions with IAF to deliver the aircraft at the earliest,” it said in a statement.

title: Google CEO thinks bloodbath in markets in reaction to Anthropic is overblown
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Nvidia's Jensen Huang dismiss market panic over AI plugins, calling it overblown.  Anthropic's new tools, particularly for legal tasks, triggered significant stock drops.  Pichai views AI as an enabling tool, while Huang argues it will enhance, not replace, existing software, urging a focus on core competencies.

title: Deals with EU, US good sign for world stability: PM Modi in Rajya Sabha
content: PM Modi’s remarks in Rajya Sabha, during the debate on the motion of thanks on the President’s address, came even as the treaty with the US is yet to be formally signed. It’s being seen as an indication that the two sides may have resolved their differences. The formal announcement of the deal is likely next week.

title: Police can’t arrest an accused simply to ask questions: Supreme Court
content: Enumerating various sections of the newly enacted Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023, a bench of Justices M M Sundresh and N K Singh said a notice under Section 35(3) of the law to an accused or any individual concerned, qua offences punishable with imprisonment of up to 7 years, is the rule.

title: India, six Gulf nations set stage to launch FTA talks
content: Gulf Cooperation Council  — comprising Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia and UAE — is a key trade and investment partner for India, with exports of nearly $57 billion and imports of around $122 billion, accounting for over 15% of India’s total global trade. Trade with GCC has grown at an average annual rate of about 15% in the last five years.

title: Dell sued by 5 ex-employees; complaint alleges that the company mismanaged its 401(k) plan
content: Five ex-Dell employees are suing the tech giant, alleging its 401(k) plan mismanagement cost workers over $318 million. The lawsuit claims Dell violated federal law by keeping workers in underperforming investment funds while profiting from its own products.  This class action seeks to recover losses and reform the retirement plan's operations.

title: In Rajya Sabha, Kharge refers to LS row, draws BJP fire
content: Kharge’s reference to LS proceedings drew a sharp response from BJP, with Leader of the House in RS JP Nadda mocking Rahul as “abodh balak (ignorant child)” and reminding Kharge that events of one House cannot be debated in another. Nadda asked Kharge not to let Congress become “hostage” to Rahul and said arrogance and ignorance should not dictate actions.

title: Open to exploring oil supplies from Venezuela: Govt
content: “Consistent with India’s approach to energy security, India remains open to exploring the commercial merits of any new crude supply options, including from Venezuela,” said the official. On India’s energy sourcing, the official recalled that govt had stated publicly on several occasions that ensuring the energy security of 1.4 billion Indians was the supreme priority of govt.

title: Rs 3,200 crore stuck in Northeast projects; Assam tops unpaid list
content: State-wise figures show Assam topping the list with Rs 1,012.87 crore pending across 35 projects, followed by Manipur (Rs 441.38 crore), Nagaland (Rs 406.09 crore) and Arunachal Pradesh (Rs 395.37 crore). Other states with large unpaid amounts include Tripura (Rs 308.71 crore), Mizoram (Rs 275.81 crore), Meghalaya (Rs 258.05 crore) and Sikkim (Rs 107.90 crore).

title: OpenAI sees exit of senior-level employees after CEO makes it compulsory to use ChatGPT
content: OpenAI is experiencing a significant exodus of senior researchers as CEO Sam Altman prioritizes ChatGPT development over long-term AI exploration.  Key figures, including a VP of research, have departed due to resource allocation disputes, with experimental projects reportedly sidelined.  This strategic shift, driven by intense competition, leaves some teams feeling marginalized and questioning their original research goals.

title: Joint statement on US trade deal soon, pact may be signed mid-March: Goyal
content: ​Their tariffs are executive tariffs. Our tariffs are MFN tariffs (rates applicable to countries with which concessional or FTA rates have not been worked out). So MFN tariff reduction can only take place after the legal agreement is signed, but we hope to do it fast,” commerce secretary Rajesh Agrawal said.

title: Critical minerals cooperation with US advancing rapidly: Jaishankar
content: According to the MEA, Jaishankar, in the meeting, highlighted the challenges of excessive concentration and the importance of de-risking supply, and also spoke about structured international cooperation. Jaishankar said on X that the deal opens up a new phase in India-US bilateral ties, with vast possibilities for the relationship, signalling renewed high-level engagements in the next few months.

title: Didi’s poll sop: Stipend for jobless youth, hike in payout to women
content: Finance minister Chandrima Bhattacharya on Thursday had some cheer for state govt employees too, budgeting for a 4% hike in DA. Govt rechristened its Karmashree scheme as “Mahatma Shree” and hiked the minimum number of workdays from 75 to 100 in what is being seen as a nod to Trinamool Congress’s opposition to the Centre’s decision to replace MGNREGA.

title: Bulls vs Raptors injury report: Who’s out, questionable, and starting Feb 5
content: Chicago Bulls and Toronto Raptors clash Thursday, both battling for Eastern Conference playoff spots amidst significant roster disruptions.  With key players sidelined due to trades and injuries, this game hinges on depth, rebounding, and guard play. The Bulls have dominated the season series, but Toronto's defense aims to challenge Chicago's depleted lineup.

title: Tyler Shough named NFL Rookie of the Year after standout Saints season
content: New Orleans Saints quarterback Tyler Shough has earned the Pepsi Zero Sugar NFL Rookie of the Year award. Stepping in mid-season, he revitalized the Saints' campaign, leading them to a winning record in their final nine games.

title: NHL prospect Gavin McKenna released on $20K bail after felony assault
content: Penn State forward and top 2026 NHL draft prospect Gavin McKenna was arrested on felony assault charges following an altercation near campus. McKenna, facing aggravated assault and other charges, was released on $20,000 bail. The incident reportedly involved McKenna punching a victim, causing facial injuries requiring surgery.

title: Manipur erupts over Nemcha Kipgen as new deputy CM
content: ​​The influential Kuki Zo Council declared a social boycott of any legislator from the community joining CM Yumnam Khemchand Singh’s govt. Protesters burned tyres and blocked roads in Kangpokpi district, and at least one group called for a shutdown in the hills. In Kangpokpi, roads littered with burning tyres signalled a return to unrest after a period of relative calm across the hills.

title: 16 killed in blast at illegal coal mine in Meghalaya
content: ​PM Narendra Modi condoled the loss of lives in the the mishap and announced an ex gratia of Rs 2 lakh from PMNRF for the next of kin of each deceased and Rs 50,000 to the injured. According to a PTI report, DGP I Nongrang has confirmed recovery of 16 bodies so far. “The exact number of labourers present inside the mine at the time of the explosion is yet to be ascertained. More people are feared trapped,” she said.

title: Treat Chinese manjha deaths as murder, CM Yogi orders officials
content: Asked how the directive will be implemented, additional chief secretary (home) Sanjay Prasad said, “We are working on a legal and procedural framework to ensure any death caused due to the use of banned Chinese manjha is treated as a case of murder. Clear instructions will be issued to the police so that strict action can be taken against all those involved in its sale, supply or use.”

title: Unlike in 3 other opposition states, West Bengal sees governor-govt cordiality
content: West Bengal governor CV Ananda Bose  read out portions of the address highlighting law and order, including references to Kolkata being among the safest cities in the country. In a rare display of cordiality, he was even seen briefly holding hands and speaking with CM Mamata Banerjee after his address, prompting BJP legislators to sarcastically comment “well done”, as he exited the House.

title: NCLT recalls order awarding Alchemist to ‘sister concern’
content: The withdrawal of the corporate resolution order by NCLT, a rare occurrence, happened after Enforcement Directorate approached the Delhi bench with evidence of money laundering by the group and how the promoters had allegedly created a front entity with “proceeds of crime”, making it a financial creditor with 97% voting rights to grab the firm under insolvency proceedings.

title: Autonomy pact inked for 6 Nagaland districts
content: As part of the arrangement, there will be devolution of powers relating to 46 subjects to FNTA, which will cover the districts of Tuensang, Mon, Kiphire, Longleng, Noklak and Shamator. The autonomy and greater say will address the long-standing grievances of ENPO over lack of equitable development in eastern Nagaland districts.

title: Fearing ‘unpleasant act’ by oppn, asked PM to skip Lok Sabha: Birla
content: “Had such an unpleasant act happened, then its sight would have torn the country’s democratic traditions to shreds,” Om Birla said amid protests from opposition MPs. PM Modi’s scheduled reply to the Motion of Thanks on the President’s address was called off at last minute on Wednesday due to intense protest from opposition MPs.

title: CPWD bought 405 air purifiers in 4 years, for babus & courts
content: In a written reply, housing and urban affairs ministry said during 2023–24 and 2024–25, CPWD procured 300 air purifiers. “The devices were issued to offices, chambers, VVIP lounges, dining halls of judges and registrar of SC, courtrooms, ministers, Constitution Club of India, LS/RS secretariats in Parliament complex and various offices of ministries, departments at Nirman Bhavan, Sewa Bhavan, Vigyan Bhavan, and CPWD offices at Jodhpur and Varanasi,” it said.

title: LIC eyes higher yields from real estate
content: Addressing a press conference after the board meeting, the corporation’s MD & CEO R Doraiswamy said LIC has decided to go slow on its earlier announced plan of entering the health insurance business, which was announced by his predecessor. For the quarter ended Dec 2025, the corporation reported standalone net profit of Rs 12,958 crore, up 17.2% from Rs 11,056 crore in the corresponding year-ago period.

title: Teacher who reached out to never-been-to-school kids honoured with $1m global prize
content: Global Teacher Prize 2026 was presented at World Governments Summit in Dubai, an annual gathering of leaders and policymakers. Now in its tenth year, the prize — an initiative of Varkey Foundation along with Unesco — honours teachers whose work reshaped learning outcomes and communities. Nagi, who has developed pedagogy around art, began her work in the slums of Mumbai about a decade ago.

title: Railways lowers target for passenger revenue, may earn less from freight too
content: In the freight segment, the ministry has estimated earnings of around Rs 1.88 lakh crore in FY27, the same as the BE of FY26 and about 6% higher than the RE of the current fiscal year. Data also show that railways are likely to end up generating around Rs 1.78 lakh crore by March, around 5.5% less than the target set for the current year.

title: India’s agricultural interests fully secure under US deal: Chouhan
content: Underlining that India’s staple grains, fruits, major crops, millets and dairy products remain completely secure and face no threat whatsoever, Chouhan emphasised that the interests of small and large farmers alike have been fully protected and that the agreement will create fresh opportunities rather than risks for Indian agriculture. He said that reduced tariffs will directly benefit India’s rice, spices and textile exports, and that growth in textile exports will help millions of cotton-growing farmers.

title: Pir Panjal row roils J&K assembly as BJP MLA refuses apology
content: The row comes weeks after PDP president Mehbooba Mufti pitched for a separate administrative division comprising Rajouri and Poonch in Pir Panjal along with Chenab valley districts, citing remoteness, hilly terrain and lack of infrastructure — a demand BJP opposed. The region refers to the mountainous belt along the Pir Panjal range south of Kashmir valley and close to the LoC.

title: Celina Jaitly seeks PM Modi’s help for brother Vikrant Kumar Jaitly detained in UAE
content: Celina Jaitly has appealed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi to intervene in the case of her brother, Major Vikrant Kumar Jaitly, a former Indian Army Special Forces officer who has been detained in the United Arab Emirates since September 2024. Speaking to India Today, Celina broke down while recounting what she described as an unlawful and opaque detention that has stretched on for over 16 months.

title: Govt questions Sixth Schedule limits, statehood fiscal burden at Ladakh talks
content: Govt also sought clarity on the financial burden of granting Ladakh full statehood with a legislature, including salaries, provident fund liabilities and other expenditures for about 19,000 employees. Running a state or a Union territory with a legislature involves managing deficits and long-term fiscal responsibility, prompting the panel to press Ladakhi activists for detailed projections, the sources said.

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo addresses trade rumors in blunt Instagram post
content: Milwaukee Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo addressed trade rumors via an Instagram story, reassuring fans of his commitment to the team. Despite recent injuries, his consistent scoring has fueled speculation, but Antetokounmpo has repeatedly stated his desire to remain with the Bucks, pledging his loyalty and expressing his intent to compete with his current team.

title: T20 WC: SLC writes to PCB after Pakistan’s stand of boycotting India fixture in Colombo
content: Sri Lanka Cricket has written to the Pakistan Cricket Board urging it to reconsider Pakistan’s decision to boycott the T20 World Cup match against India in Colombo, warning of major financial losses and damage to tourism. Invoking Sri Lanka’s tours of Pakistan despite grave security threats, including the 2009 convoy attack, SLC appealed for reciprocity in the broader interests of the game.

title: Ghaziabad sisters' suicide: 'Death better than beatings', daughters wrote in diary
content: Three sisters, aged 16, 14, and 12, died after falling from the ninth floor of their Ghaziabad apartment building. A neighbor witnessed the eldest sister on the window ledge with the younger two holding her, before they all fell. Police are investigating, with a diary and mobile phone recovered from the puja room.

title: No more misleading ads: SC makes self-declaration mandatory before every ad
content: The Supreme Court highlighted that the misleading advertisements are not a minor regulatory issue but a direct consumer rights concern inherently connected with the health of people and trust in society

title: IED found in Rajouri; balloon with PIA marking seized in Udhampur
content:
-

JAMMU: Security forces recovered an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) in J&K’s Rajouri district Thursday, while a balloon with “PIA” (Pakistan International Airlines) markings was seized in Udhampur district. Officials said a team of security personnel rushed to Khablan village in Rajouri’s Thanamandi after being alerted about the discovery of a suspicious object. Upon detecting the IED, forces cordoned off the area following SOPs and summoned the Bomb Disposal Squad, which neutralised the explosive. Police launched an investigation, said officials. Meanwhile, an aeroplane-shaped balloon with PIA markings was found in Kera area of Laddan in Udhampur district. Police took cognisance of the recovery, said sources.

End of Article

title: Trump sails into a Columbus controversy
content: the decision is the latest flashpoint in the cultural and political battle over how the united states understands its origins . one historian says valorizes brigands and freebooters who plundered a “stolen land” but one says is "heroic" he set out in 1492 not to discover a new continent, but to find a westward sea route to India and its riches .

title: 'Bengal ki nirmam sarkar': Poll-bound states find special mention in PM's RS speech
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: Nine NBA trade season questions: What's next for Giannis? Did the Lakers improve?
content: the 2026 trade deadline is officially over, and a flurry of deals has shaken up both conferences with just a few months left in the regular season . the lakers were on the move this week, with James Harden heading to the Cleveland Cavaliers in exchange for darius Garland .

title: Men's Power Rankings: A static top 5 (for now), but big rises (Kansas) and drops (Gonzaga, BYU) elsewhere
content: the top of the men's college basketball Power Rankings has remained pretty stagnant for weeks now . even Illinois, the newest member of the top five, is riding a 12-game winning streak and hasn't lost since Dec. 13 . before the next edition of the rankings, four of our top-five teams have road games against other top-25 teams .

title: Re-ranking the Premier League: Who's up? Who's down?
content: Oliver Glasner was named manager of the month for september . he will be followed up by Enzo Maresca, whose Chelsea won three and drew one in November . Glasner has publicly stated that he'll be leaving his club . click here for all the latest transfer news .

title: ‘J&K reported 2 lakh dog bites cases in past 2 years’
content: as many as 206,460 dog bite cases were reported in the past two years . jammu division accounting for 126,844 cases and Kashmir valley 79,616 cases . state health and medical education minister Sakina Itoo said in a written reply, there was no report of an increase in the population of stray dogs within its limits .

title: 'Modi teri kabr khudegi': PM Modi says oppn masking hate behind 'Mohabbat ki dukaan'
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: Transfer rumors, news: Barça, Madrid linked with Tottenham's Romero
content: Cristian Romero is attracting interest from Barcelona and real madrid . the 27-year-old is reportedly growing frustrated over Spurs' recruitment strategy . he hinted at the north London club's lack of squad depth on twitter .

title: Who makes Mike Macdonald's defense so good? Seahawks to watch in Super Bowl LX
content: the seahawks are on a more impressive Super Bowl run than the Patriots . the Seahawks have held opponents to 10 points or fewer five times . it's the biggest reason the Seattles won a club-record 14 games during the regular season .

title: NHL trade grades: Who comes out ahead in Artemi Panarin trade?
content: the 2025-26 NHL trade season is off to a busy start . the Vancouver Canucks traded defenseman Rasmus Andersson to the Vegas Golden Knights . earlier, the Pittsburgh Penguins sent goaltender Tristan Jarry and forward Sam Poulin to the Edmonton Oilers .

title: Uttar Pradesh CM orders State-wide campaign, action against Chinese kite string
content: “Chinese kite string is completely banned and its continued availability is a matter of serious concern. All police officials across the State should launch intensive raid operations,” Mr. Adityanath said

title: Mysuru’s Mylari dosa launches in Bengaluru drawing crowds, and the Chief Minister
content: Mysuru’s ‘Old Original’ Vinayaka Mylari dosa’s Bengaluru restaurant, inaugurated by Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, is drawing a long line of customers. We join them to try the signature soft masala dosa with white butter and green sagu

title: Orissa HC directs to stop movement of illegally raised minerals
content: Odisha government has been directed to file an affidavit on actions taken to contain illegal mining activities within three weeks

title: TRAI issues Telecommunication (Broadcasting and Cable) Services Interconnection (Addressable Systems) (Seventh Amendment) Regulations, 2026
content: Clearly defined timelines for audits; Audit is to be done on financial year basis in place of calendar year; and Broadcasters can depute their representative during audit to ensure transparency and credibility of the audit process, among the main features of the regulations

title: FIR over scuffle in BHU campus as UGC issue take centre stage
content: A physical altercation at Banaras Hindu University (BHU) on February 3, 2026, occurred after M.A. History student Adarsh Kumar reported being attacked for sharing a protest poster on new UGC regulations. While the FIR does not explicitly connect the violence to the UGC issue, he claims it stemmed from a WhatsApp debate on the topic

title: Congress appoints former CM Okram Ibobi Singh as its Manipur unit chief
content: The party appointed Meghachandra as the new Congress Legislature Party Leader with K. Ranjit Singh as his deputy

title: UT with Assembly model should be done away with from Constitution: J&K CM Omar Abdullah
content: “It’s very hard to work as CM of a UT with Assembly. I appeal to the Prime Minister to as a gift to this nation abolish this system from the Constitution. Either it should be a State or a UT without Assembly. It’s like tying the hand of government from behind and is a fraud with the mandate of people,” said Mr. Abdullah

title: Amit Shah embarks on two-day J&K visit
content: Senior Congress leader and legislator Tariq Hameed Karra said frequent visits by Amit Shah were “an indication of the fact that things were not normal in J&K”

title: SC tells Bengal govt. to pay 25% DA by March 31
content: Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari called court verdict a ‘defeat’ for Mamata Banerjee and ‘major win’ for government employees

title: T.N.’s first glow garden opens at Mamallapuram
content: An amphitheatre, food kiosks, selfie points, walkways lined with artificial trees, plants and flowers, and seats that light up are among the features of the garden that has come up on TTDC land

title: TMC govt. hikes monthly aid for women, unveils scheme for unemployed
content: ₹4.06-lakh-crore interim budget tabled ahead of West Bengal Assembly election; under ‘Banglar Yuba Sathi’, monthly allowance of ₹1,500 will be given to jobless youth; BJP terms it a ‘deception’

title: Maoist killed, C-60 commando injured in encounter in Gadchiroli; two Maoist camps destroyed
content: The operation involving 14 C-60 units under SDPO Bhamragd began near Phodewada village on Gadchiroli-Narayanpur border after specific intelligence was received on Tuesday (February 3, 2026) evening about the presence of ultras of company number 10 of the outlawed Communist Party of India (Maoist), an official said

title: Opposition slams Tamil Nadu Agriculture Minister’s remarks on North Indian migrant workers
content: ‘North Indians come to Tamil Nadu only to sell panipuri, work in construction (sector), and wipe tables’, says Tamil Nadu Agriculture Minister M.R.K. Panneerselvam; AIADMK, BJP slam Minister; DMK defends him

title: Between 2019 and 2025, nearly 28% of road accident victims in Karnataka were pedestrians: CJ Vibhu Bakhru
content: e-DAR, an online system aimed at faster, more efficient reporting and processing of road accident cases, was inaugurated in Karnataka

title: India’s strategic future lies in universities, innovation hubs, says  IGCAR former Director
content: Young Researchers’ Conclave features Young Scientists’ sessions and live demonstrations and advanced rocket kit launches

title: Cabinet clears AI-powered software to identify hate speech, misinformation and malicious campaigns
content: Patil says there will be no human interference in this, and that no party or government will benefit

title: Supreme Court upholds Telangana High Court decision that free allotment of land to IAMC is ‘unsustainable’
content: The top court dismisses petition filed by International Arbitration & Mediation Centre and agreed with the High Court that gratuitous distribution of natural resources was both “unsustainable and contrary to the procedure”

title: UPSC expands conditions for attempting CSEs after being allotted for IPS, Group A Services
content: Face authentication of candidates at exam venues, live photo capture during form filling made mandatory; many point out notification riddled with spelling mistakes

title: Government says 2,645 posts vacant at AAI, 3 aviation regulators
content: In a separate written reply, Mr. Mohol said that a total of 6,936 flights were cancelled by IndiGo during the last three months affecting 10,81,680 passengers

title: Sri Lankan diplomat lauds Indian government, people for relief efforts following Cyclone Ditwah
content: He also refers to the Sri Lankan government’s commitment to relief, rehabilitation, and climate-resilient development after the cyclone

title: Ranking the top 10 prospects in all 30 MLB farm systems
content: the top 10 prospects for all 30 major league farm systems are listed below . players in the big leagues are eligible for this update as MLB rookie eligibility rules apply here . there are 130 at-bats, 50 innings pitched or 45 days on the active roster .

title: Rajya Sabha adopts the Motion of Thanks amid protests by Opposition
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Priyanka Chaturvedi says even EAM had been unaware of the details of the trade deal; BJP MP Maya Naroliya says under the Modi government, the allocation to agriculture sector increased

title: Congress takes out march to condemn Union government for diluting MGNREGA
content: While speaking at a meeting, TNCC president K. Selvaperunthagai says leaders, including Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi and Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge, have expressed concerns about the dilution of MGNREGA, both inside and outside Parliament

title: Congress flags ‘procedural irregularities’ in Lok Sabha
content: Rules of Procedure make it mandatory for PM to explain government’s position at the end of the debate or inform the House of his inability to do so, says Congress; seeks Speaker’s explanation

title: NHRC issues notice over allegations of exploitation, forced religious conversion of women at gyms
content: The Commission directs Chief Secretaries of States, Union Territories to form guidelines/policy/registration norms and standards for such establishments

title: No takers for ₹57-lakh truss work at Mundamveli apartments
content: The truss installation was cleared after a three-member panel, including an expert from IIT Madras, conducted a structural stability analysis in August 2025

title: SRM University-A.P. invites applications for M.Tech courses, deadline February 15
content: Candidates can submit their applications forms by visiting  the official werbsite  https://applications.srmap.edu.in/m-tech

title: Kuki-Zo groups boycott tribal MLAs in Manipur government, accuse them of ‘betrayal’
content: The Kuki-Zo Council said that by joining a Meitei-dominated government, the Kuki-Zo MLAs have disregarded the pain and sacrifices endured by the community during the ethnic conflict

title: Court cannot examine correctness of route for metro line, says Karnataka HC
content: However, court asks authorities to examine concern of property owners and business establishments of Nagarbhavi

title: Experts prepare to tranquilise tiger after second cattle kill
content: Pune-based RESQ experts joined the monitoring exercise and Hyderabad-based HyTICOs experts will join the operation on Friday; The tiger moved along the borders of Konaseema, Kakinada by Thursday night

title: V.S. Achuthanandan’ s son says CPI(M) will decide whether or not to accept Padma Vibhushan
content: The party V.S. Achuthanandan represented has a clear stance on accepting official honours. As a communist, he held such values and the party’s decisions closely. So the family’s decision on accepting the honour will be in tandem with the CPI(M)’s position on the matter, says Arun Kumar

title: High Court quashes order on Group-1 revaluation; brings relief to 563 appointees
content: The Division Bench rejected the single bench order and allowed the appeals filed by the selected candidates for their continuation in the long-pending recruitment process for 563 Group-1 posts in the State.

title: Efficient water management will ensure a drought-free State: Naidu
content: Water Users' Associations play a key role in water governance, works will be allotted to irrigation associations without GST, while allowing them to collect water tax and manage canals efficiently, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu

title: Meghalaya coal mine explosion LIVE: At least 18 people dead; several feared trapped
content: The East Jaintia Hills district police confirmed the recovery of 18 bodies and said the people died after an explosion inside the mine that trapped them

title: Ghaziabad deaths renew focus on gaming addiction among children in Karnataka
content: Doctors at NIMHANS say they are witnessing a steady rise in children seeking help for problematic technology and gaming use

title: Govt is determined it won’t allow LoP to speak in both Houses, says Congress chief
content: Kharge says Opposition was forced to walk out of the Rajya Sabha because the government was not ready to listen; Congress leaders slam PM’s speech as partisan and misleading

title: Laddu row: one-man panel a diversionary tactic by TDP, says YSRCP
content: Party leaders deny allegations that the Central Food Technological Research Institute report was suppressed during the YSRCP government’s tenure

title: ‘Udhayam’ agri-entrepreneurship meet draws huge crowd
content: A wide range of spices, agricultural produce, and processed foods were showcased, with the participation of around 100 micro and small entrepreneurs from Kozhikode and neighbouring areas

title: Webinar on biotechnology education to be held on February 8
content: The session will bring together experts from academia, international education, and research to discuss how biotechnology education is evolving to meet the demands of a sustainable and innovation-led future

title: Vigilance arrests former priest over ‘irregularities’ in sale of ghee at Sabarimala
content: Vigilance investigation finds that Sunilkumar Potti, 13th accused, misappropriated and converted the sale proceeds of 62 packets of ghee worth ₹68,200, for his use for 17 days

title: Tensions escalate in Rajya Sabha over Rahul issue, Opposition stages walkout
content: Opposition flags events in LS, accuses government of preventing LoP Rahul Gandhi from speaking; Chair says LS proceedings cannot be discussed in RS, stops Mr. Kharge from reading Navarane memoir excerpts

title: Army renames 246 roads, buildings, and facilities to shed colonial legacy
content: The Indian Army stated that the revised nomenclature gives pride of place to the nation’s gallantry awardees, battle heroes and distinguished military leaders
